intro: Bryonia capillacea, commonly known as the slender bryony, is a climbing plant belonging to the family Cucurbitaceae. It is characterized by its hairy, slender stems and heart-shaped leaves with a waxy texture. The plant produces yellow flowers that develop into green, spiny fruits. It is native to southern Europe and parts of western Asia. Bryonia capillacea is often found in dry, rocky habitats and is known for its medicinal properties in traditional herbal medicine.
